Change has been successfully rebased and submitted as 7d243eb7d1fafef191372146249ddafc5cadb4e8

I tried the patch but I am getting connection timeout when I run simple query.

curl -s -k https://$bmc/redfish/v1/Managers/bmc
It is not clear to me how the buffer is chopped into small pieces. Shouldn't we update buffer or parser to specify small size.
I think this is fine.
The buffer isn't "chopped into pieces" the async_read_some only returns was could be read in a single operation, to allow tracking.
Isn't there a issue of stack overflow due to recursion for large image? I think it is better to write a loop here instead of recursion.
I understood it now. the callback function is posted in separate thread.
Correct.  There is no recursion here.
https://gerrit.openbmc.org/c/openbmc/bmcweb/+/60390 is the alternative
If userSession is not active and async_read_some returns partial data then we are calling startDeadline() timer without canceling earlier one.
Added flag at the connection object to track whether timer is started or not. If it is already started then don't restart.
This code is ready to review.
LGTM
Does this handle insecure-disable-authx correctly?
It handles it the same as it always did.  The timer changes never worked with disable-authx so far as I can tell.

I tried to upload with insecure connection and also disable-auth and it is failing after partial upload. 

curl: (56) Recv failure: Connection reset by peer or sometime curl: (55) Send failure: Broken pipe

Is it failing due to the timer reason mentioned by Ed.

ok, I have confirmed that userSession pointer is null when disable-auth is enabled. Hence we are not refreshing the timer value.

Do we need to fix this issue?
Updated code to handle disable authentication. Timer will be refreshed as long as progress is made.
I've removed this for now, because it makes the code much worse, and the behavior previously is maintained.  We can follow up in another patch if we want to change the behavior.
I am fine with that.

I feel that current implementation is better as it has less code.
1,2 - We need to add if else which is more code.
3 - is not correct as we may end up calling cancel twice.
